alert.note: Alert for St. Johns; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 13 at 1:49AM EDT until March 13 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida and northern Florida, including the following counties, in northeast Florida, Clay, Duval and St. Johns. In northern Florida, Bradford and Union. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Starke, Raiford, Middleburg, Mandarin, Fruit Cove, Doctors Inlet, Lakeside, Fleming Island, Bellair-Meadowbrook Terrace, Switzerland, Camp Blanding, Kingsley, Bayard, Durbin, Nocatee, Palm Valley, Sawgrass and Guana River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
